Firebird AST is seeking a Data Science Analyst to support our government client and forward deployed units. Candidate will provide analytical support to our client and focus on countering improvised threats and the networks that finance, build, or employ such threats. RESPONSIBILITIES Provide large-scale advanced analytics support; collect, parse, transform, and integrate relevant data in support of projects; and provide operational, systems, and data analysis to support the mission.  Provide data supporting strategic and operational requests from deployed and deploying units. Data may be used to: assist decision makers with risk assessments, prioritization, and/or to provide leadership with quantitative organizational assessments to support functional evaluations.  Develop, document, implement, and automate ETL (extract transform load) processes using SQL® and other analytical programming tools that most efficiently import structured, semi-structured, and unstructured data from new and/or dynamic data sources, ensuring data validity, reliability, and availability to users.  Collaborate with team members to ensure retrieval of information pertinent to current work and timely dissemination of counter asymmetric threat products.   REQUIRED  Current Top Secret/Specialized Compartmented Information Security Clearance.  Bachelor's degree in a technical field or 4 years of experience.  Familiarization with SQL processes and ability to conduct ETL processing in an SQL database.  Significant experience programming in at least one other programming language (Python, R,).  The ability to effectively communicate both orally and in writing.  Must be able to travel locally up to 10% of the time.   PREFERRED  Degree in a quantitative discipline such as: Operations Research, Applied Mathematics, Engineering, Science, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Statistics.  Experience with data wrangling, web scrapping, and pulling data from API’s.  Knowledge of how to utilize business intelligence tools and processes that improve readability of and access to data, through the creation of stored/scheduled processes and effective visualization.  Ability to create complex programs that ingest, parse, clean, transform, and analyze large (millions of records) datasets; and to deliver analytical results through written and oral presentations.  Experience interacting with “big data” systems such as Hadoop or Amazon Web Services (AWS).  Experience building and managing data workflows.  Familiarity with the process of building and maintaining dashboards (e.g., Plotly or Tableau).  Prior experience as an all-source intelligence analyst, business analysts, or ORSAs  Prior experience with Counter UAS operations.   KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ATTRIBUTES  Ability to read, analyze, and interpret technical journals, reports, policy, legal documents, etc.  Ability to prepare reports and presentations to company management and customer(s).  Demonstrated leadership ability, strategic and innovative thinker, and passion for the mission.  Ability to identify and solve problems.  Excellent organization and time management skills.   EDUCATION  Bachelor’s degree in a technical field.  CLEARANCE  Active/current DoD TS/SCI   About Firebird AST:  Firebird AST is a Service Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) based in Northern Virginia and a market-recognized leader within the IC, Department of Defense, Homeland Security, and Law Enforcement. We maintain a corporate culture deeply rooted in the US Military core values that gave us our start - honor, integrity, commitment, and selfless service. For this reason, our customers' needs and missions always comes first. We seek hard working, highly experienced, extremely motivated, professionally proven subject matter experts, trainers, leaders, innovators, and technical experts to serve on our team. Firebird AST has a firm understanding that our employees are our greatest asset and that, accordingly, they are to be provided the greatest level of respect and care possible.  Firebird AST is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Location:  Arlington, VA     Clearance Required:  Secret clearance required; Top Secret with eligibility for Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI) desired.     Background:     Assured Consulting Solutions provides strategic and innovative solutions for customer needs across the business, technology, and organizational spectrum. As a member of our team, you will have the chance to work with customers that are both Government and industry leaders and technology innovators.     We are seeking a highly motivated  Data Scientist Lead  to join our team. The Data Scientist Lead will provide technical expertise, technical direction, quality assurance, and leadership of the Data Cell. The Data Scientist Lead will report to the Task Order Program Manager (TOPM) and support the National Security Innovation Network's (NSIN) Data Cell mission. NSIN's Data Cell has the responsibility of leading NSIN's use of data to evaluate the progress as an organization and driving the organization to increasingly adopt data and its use as a core component of decision making.     This position is with the National Security Innovation Network (NSIN), a program office within the Department of Defense (DoD) Undersecretary of Defense for Research and Engineering (R&E), its mission is to bring together defense, academia, and industry to solve some of the most challenging security problems facing the United States (U.S.). Through NSINs programming it leverages pools of talent that possess two key characteristics: 1) a penchant for iterative experimentation (i.e., learned adaptability), and 2) organic incentive structures for finding difficult answers to key questions. In both cases, the early-stage venture community and the academic community present untapped pools of innovators that the DoD has not figured out how to adequately leverage. This effort will facilitate the discovery of new technologies, processes, and applications to meet capability gaps for the DoD. These technologies, processes and applications will be discovered through an expanding NSIN collaborative network and then shaped by DoD end users through interactions facilitated by NSIN programs.     Responsibilities include, but are not limited to :            The Data Scientist Lead will contribute by providing independent data analysis and manage the selection, implementation, and use of any required data analysis platforms leveraged by the Data Cell.      The Data Scientist Lead will provide technical expertise, technical direction, quality assurance, and leadership of the NSIN Data Cell.      The Data Scientist Lead will manage the day-to-day work of the Data Cell contractor team and work as a team member to provide necessary data-driven insights, such as the successful execution of core data cell responsibilities.      This role also includes leading the Data Cell in proactively and responsively providing data-driven insights at the request of the Managing Director, Chief of Staff, and Director of Research.        Required Qualifications:         A minimum of 5 years of experience with one or more data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Domo, Google Analytics, Salesforce, Power BI, or equivalent tools).      A Secret Clearance.      A minimum of 5 years of experience, within the last 10 years, working in leading Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or Database Management, or a combination of all three in a corporate or Government setting.      A minimum of 5 years of experience communicating complex data insights in a professional or academic setting.      A minimum of 5 years of experience, within the last 10 years, with relational databases, Database Management System (DBMS) and related programming languages, (e.g., SQL, R, and Python).        Desired Qualifications:            Experience teaching an organization to utilize data as a key component of the decision-making process.      A TS clearance with eligibility for SCI.       Experience leading a team or multiple teams concurrently.       Experience implementing large new scale data platforms across a distributed organization.        Essential Job Functions:         Must be able to remain in a stationary position 50% of the time      The person in this position needs to occasionally move about inside the office to access file cabinets, office machinery, etc.      Constantly operates a computer and other office productivity machinery, such as a calculator, copy machine and computer printer      The person in this position frequently communicates with co-workers, management and customers. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations.        Education Requirement:  None listed.     Years of Experience:         A minimum of 5 years of experience with one or more data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Domo, Google Analytics, Salesforce, Power BI, or equivalent tools).      A minimum of 5 years of experience, within the last 10 years, working in leading Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, or Database Management, or a combination of all three in a corporate or Government setting.      A minimum of 5 years of experience communicating complex data insights in a professional or academic setting.      A minimum of 5 years of experience, within the last 10 years, with relational databases, Database Management System (DBMS) and related programming languages, (e.g., SQL, R, and Python). Novavax, Inc. (Nasdaq: NVAX) is a biotechnology company that promotes improved health globally through the discovery, development, and commercialization of innovative vaccines to prevent serious infectious diseases. Novavax is currently conducting multiple late-stage clinical trials for NVX-CoV2373, our vaccine candidate against the virus that causes COVID-19, and has recently reported exciting and highly encouraging initial efficacy results. NanoFlu, our quadrivalent influenza nanoparticle vaccine, met all primary objectives in its pivotal Phase 3 clinical trial in older adults. Both candidate vaccines incorporate Novavax' proprietary saponin-based Matrix-M adjuvant to enhance the immune response and stimulate high levels of neutralizing antibodies. Novavax is a leading innovator of recombinant vaccines. Our proprietary technology platform leverages the power and speed of genetic engineering to efficiently produce highly immunogenic nanoparticles in order to address urgent global health needs.     Novavax, Inc. is headquartered in Gaithersburg, Maryland with additional facilities in Uppsala, Sweden and Bohumil, Czech Republic.     We are seeking a Statistician II/III to join our Data Science and Statistics team. This position directly supports all our nonclinical groups, and provides guidance in the utilization of appropriate statistical methodology to scientists and management at Novavax.     Responsibilities include but are not limited to:         Provide sound strategic, scientific, and statistical input to support our nonclinical research and development projects, through design of experiments and by using appropriate statistical methodology and sample size.      Prepare statistical analysis plans; analyze experimental and historical data.      Create design of experiments and perform various types of statistical analyses to develop predictive models and optimize conditions for processes, methods, and drug product/drug substance storage.      Perform stability analysis to identify degradation rates and expiration dates.      Prepare the statistical section of technical reports and presentations.      Engage in discussions and research to ensure the central place of applied statistics in research, development, quality, and validation projects.      Manage one's projects effectively, and meet deadlines with high quality of standards      Explain statistical designs and concepts to non-statisticians      Meet company milestones        Minimum requirements:         A degree in Statistics/Biostatistics, Bioengineering, Chemical Engineering, or a related field, with at least 5 year of relevant experience is preferred.      Sound knowledge of theoretical and applied statistics is required, with an emphasis on experimental design in biotechnology, power calculations, survival analysis, etc.      The candidate should have hands-on experience with using and scripting statistical software packages including JMP, SAS, and R.      Familiarity with ICH guidelines      Experience in the drug development field is preferred.      Must be an effective team player, able to thrive in a fast-paced team environment, and also work independently on projects.      Excellent interpersonal, oral, and written communication skills.      Leadership ability to influence team members and communicate statistical concepts across functions.        Novavax is headquartered in Gaithersburg, Maryland with additional facilities in Uppsala, Sweden and Bohumil, Czech Republic. Novavax is traded on the Nasdaq Stock Market under the symbol NVAX and is dedicated to developing novel vaccines to address infectious disease. job_title: Director of Machine Learning & AI, Customer Analytics
job_Description: You'll be an important part of our high-energy, unique, fast-paced, and innovative culture that delivers with the agility of a tech startup and the backing of a leading global consulting firm. In this particular role, you'll work specifically in the AI Analytics & Engineering Community within the Digital Lighthouse, on a wide range of projects. From applied AI to optimization to big data platform engineering, your analytical and technical skills will drive real impact in the business world. At KPMG, our commitment to your career development helps to set us apart as an employer. We want to enhance your potential, both for yourself and as a contributor to our firm. That's why we provide every opportunity to expand your skills, knowledge and experiences through formal education and training programs, leadership development opportunities, and, as well as informal one-on-one coaching and mentoring from your KPMG colleagues. KPMG is currently seeking a Director to join our KPMG Lighthouse - Center of Excellence for Advanced Analytics. Responsibilities:  Lead proposal life cycle in the Customer Analytics space across industry by working very closely with KPMG internal experts to develop joint go to market plans and coordinate business development efforts. Lead responses to RFIs and RFPs from potential clients, budgeting time and cost between various internal teams, leading discussions with clients through the proposal process, and demonstrating leadership through the entire process. Partner with other KPMG practices to identify and lead the development of new cutting-edge AI and ML solutions that are specifically focused around improving performance in the Customer Analytics space. Overseeing the creation of machine learning models to gain greater insight on operational and marketing strategies, through all phases of development, from design through training, evaluation, validation, and implementation Lead workshops and innovation sessions with clients, multi-disciplinary, and cross-functional teams to identify business opportunities, define problem statements, and design high level analytical solutions Learn, communicate and apply best practices to plan, lead, and execute delivery of Data/AI engagements; working across different front office functions (marketing, sales, customer service and customer experience) Lead in a fast-paced and dynamic environment utilizing virtual and face-to-face interactions; manage complex work streams, expectations, budgets, deliverables, and multiple responsibilities using structured approaches for operational excellence; and communicate results to executive level audiences Work with clients to discover data sources and create data requests; Lead data discovery and ETL/ELT processes to ingest structured data and annotation processes to enrich unstructured data leveraging a variety of data sources (social media, news, internal/external documents, images, video, voice, emails, financial data, and operational data) Plan engagement objectives and key deliverables while managing using analytic processes to mitigate risks in data, modeling, validation, and delivery Leverage diagnostic and advanced statistical analytics techniques to design and answer complex business questions Perform customer segmentation, cohort analyses, and create predictive behavioral models  Develop and execute analytical strategies using advanced techniques to measure digital content and fitness instructor performance Work closely with our data engineering teams, providing inputs to support the design and build our customer analytics data infrastructure Provide data & analytics products to enable fact based, enterprise decisions that drive the achievement of COA’s mission and goals Define, monitor, and report key business metrics for management team; Design, implement and manage various reporting processes and dashboards. Drive the development and improvement of the analytic environment and reporting Leverage data across CRM (Salesforce) and other business & operational platforms using dashboarding tools (Tableau, Power BI) to build a unified metric capability across all operational functions (marketing, sales, negotiations, customer support)  Qualifications:  A minimum of ten years of relevant experience and strong knowledge of data analytics and AI/ML; including at least three of the following fields: machine learning, statistics, data mining, operations research, econometrics, natural language processing, business intelligence A minimum of four years of management consulting, advisory, professional services and/or Big 4 consulting experience Master's degree or PhD from an accredited college/university in one or more of the following: Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Bioinformatics, Econometrics, Physics, Operations Research, or related fields Proficiency in analytics tools and programming languages, tools, and platforms (SAS, R, Python, Spark, Hadoop, Alteryx, etc.), databases (SQL and no-SQL), data visualization tools (Tableau, Power BI, etc.) Foundational understanding of cloud infrastructures and core services across storage, compute, machine learning, integration, etc. [preferred: practitioner certification in at least one of the 3 main cloud providers] Design and building of machine learning solutions including data pipelines (data extraction, feature engineering from structured and unstructured data); And delivering analytics projects using leading processes (strong knowledge of data discovery, cleaning, model selection, validation, and deployment). And development practices such as testing, code design, complexity, and code optimization Proven experience designing customer segmentation models, performing cohort analysis / lookalike modeling, and building predictive models to measure propensities to buy, engage, or churn Proven experience building compelling and engaging data visualization and presentations. Ability to travel when necessary; Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future  KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. Senior Data Scientist (Innovative Solutions)  About Us:  BlackSky  is a geospatial intelligence solutions provider that enables organizations to task, collect, and transform data from earth observation, global sensor networks, mobile devices, and social media to deliver on-demand insights about places, events, and assets that are critical to their operations. BlackSky provides satellite collection, data, and cloud based -processing and analytic solutions to organizations that are capitalizing on the exponential growth of a wide range of sensor and collection platforms for delivering the next generation of GEOINT and location intelligence solutions. BlackSky has extensive expertise and capabilities in commercial remote sensing, multi-source analytics, cloud computing, open source software development, Amazon Web Services, and big data geospatial analytics. BlackSky provides solutions to commercial and government organizations with relevant programs with the National Geospatial Intelligence Agency (NGA), US. Army, and U.S. Air Force Research Labs.  The BlackSky Innovative Solutions Group leverages BlackSky's global sensor network, advanced artificial intelligence platform, and third-party data sources to develop high-impact data feeds for commercial and government customers.  BlackSky is looking for a talented and creative Senior Data Scientist to build solutions which meet customer requirements. As part of the Innovative Solutions Group, you will be responsible for solving challenging problems and delivering pilots and solutions to BlackSky's customers using the latest data feeds and geospatial analysis tools. You will build models and algorithms using data from BlackSky's constellation of satellites, Spectra AI machine learning platform, and third-party. You will work with many stakeholders both within and outside of BlackSky to ensure successful execution and delivery of customer solutions.  The ideal candidate has extensive data science experience, strong programming skills; experience working alongside software teams; and success working in an agile development environment. Additionally, the ideal candidate has demonstrated the ability to manage their own efforts over a broad scope of work as an independent contributor. Finally, the candidate should be an independent thinker with the demonstrated ability and willingness to lean in and solve new problems.  BlackSky is seeking a Senior Data Scientist in our Herndon, VA Location. While the job location listed here is ideal, we are open to hiring this position in our Seattle/Washington DC suburb offices or remotely in the following states: AL, AR, AZ, CO, CA, DC, DE, FL, IN, MA, MD, NC, NM, OH, OR, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VA, WA, WV.  Responsibilities:   Develop automated solutions to solve customer problems utilizing BlackSky's global sensor network, the Spectra AI platform, customer and third-party data/tools, and open-source data to deliver high-impact insights to our customers.  Build statistical and machine learning models to automate the analysis of satellite imagery, geospatial vectored data feeds, timeseries, and other structured and unstructured data.  Contribute to the engineering roadmap process by highlighting technical gaps and opportunities impacting the Innovative Solutions Group.  Take part in the entire pilot and project lifecycle from developing requirements, to soliciting customer feedback, to solution deployment and management.  Collaborate with BlackSky stakeholders on product and platform strategy including sales, product management, engineering, and leadership.   Required Qualifications:   Minimum of five years of hands-on experience as data scientist, machine learning engineer, or artificial intelligence engineer with at least three years of hands-on programming experience.  Bachelor's Degree or higher in one of the following fields: computer science, data science, mathematics, physics, statistics, or another computational field.  Python3 proficiency and familiarity with scientific and data processing libraries such as NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, scikit-learn, and OpenCV.  Hands on experience working with and managing processing of large datasets and computational or analytic jobs.   Preferred Qualifications:   Knowledge and experience with geospatial data and satellite imagery.  Familiarity with data ETL and processing technologies such as Luigi, Apache Airflow, Dask, Apache Spark, EMR and/or AWS Kinesis.  Experience with cloud-based software development and deployments particularly using Amazon Web Services.  Ability to obtain and maintain a US security clearance.   BlackSky is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer All  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.  EEO/AAP/ Pay Transparency Statements :  https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf  https://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/OFCCP_EEO_Supplement_Final_JRF_QA_508c.pdf  To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State.

current VA credentials preferred  Bachelor’s degree required; Studies in Statistics, Mathematics, Data Analytics, or related discipline preferred  8+ years of related experience analyzing and interpreting data for large-scale organizations  Experience with a variety of data collection methods  Experience reporting on quantified information and making recommendations to improve efficiency  Experience supporting VA or a federal government health-related program is a plus  Ability to clearly communicate and exchange information with co-workers, teammates, stakeholders, and other personnel, as required  Proficiency working across the Microsoft Office Suite, including advanced Excel skills  Work Environment/Physical Demands:  This job operates in a professional office environment with prolonged periods sitting at a desk, attending meetings, and using standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, and video teleconferencing equipment. Reporting to the Chief Human Resources Officer, the Director of HR Data Science and HRIS is responsible for contributing to and executing upon a company-wide strategic vision to continue NCI’s HR modernization and streamlining in support of the company’s overall strategy.   As a key member of the HR leadership team, the position will develop and empower peers, colleagues, and direct reports to perform to the best of their abilities, grow their skills, in support of business objectives. As a project manager, the position will drive successful completion of key initiatives in the Human Resources function, and interface with other functional areas of the business to collaborate and drive innovation. The position requires a strategic thinker, able to collaboratively solve complex business problems that align with the needs and values of the organization.   The position will oversee all aspects of the company’s human resources information systems to include those of human capital management, applicant tracking, training, data analytics, and HR Solutions Hub (Workday, iCIMS, Torch, Visier, & ServiceNow - collectively the HRIS). In this capacity, the manager will have a critical role in the design, maintenance, and integration of the HRIS ensuring the systems are configured, utilized and maintained to achieve their maximum benefit. A critical aspect of this responsibility includes ensuring the HRIS data structures support and integrate with the data management systems within other functions. He/she will create capabilities that enable functional and business leadership to make evidence-based decisions. He/she will lead the implementation and management of standardized and well-documented process workflows and data frameworks to deliver consistent, high-quality insights through data analysis, at increasing levels of scale and satisfaction.   Responsibilities:      Build, maintain, and develop a team of experts who perform analysis and build human capital data products.    Create and perpetuate capabilities that enable the functional and business leaders to make evidence-based decisions by establishing analytic frameworks and functional models to assess and forecast business performance and provide recommendations for solving key problems.    Utilize a range of predictive models and tools to analyze large data sets and drive analysis that inform business solutions.    Develop and maintain well documented data architecture, enforcing standards across all systems for efficient processes and clean reliable data.    Enable leadership throughout the company through use of human capital data, enabling our people managers to be effective communicators, leaders, and mentors for their employees.    Utilize our current data platforms while expanding the palate of technical solutions available to the business.    Oversee the operation and functionality of the company’s human capital management, applicant tracking, training, service desk, and data aggregation systems.    Lead projects that improve the effectiveness and efficiencies of human resources operations and systems; perpetuate a culture of continuous process improvement    Identify and maintain KPIs and business dashboards to enable performance management and facilitate accountability.    Maintain the Human Resources budget reporting, support strategic usage of function resources and support budget monitoring among the HR departments    Manage contracts with various vendors for the HRIS, Talent Acquisition, and Talent Management departments.    Serve as a liaison among stakeholders within human resources, finance, procurement, marketing and operations, spearheading high visibility projects that streamline processes and procedures, integrate acquired companies, mitigate risk, and optimize and integrate systems and achieving the best possible ROI throughout the talent operations.     ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:      Support the management, development, ongoing maintenance, and technical support of the Workday HR System, including but not limited to HCM, Benefits, Compensation, Performance/Merit, Security and Integrations.    Serve as Workday SME to support and understand new functionality and features. Helps define and develop a plan of continual system update and improvement, aligned with Workday semi-annual release schedule.    Oversee day-to-day HRIS operation including transactional, security and internal/external integration issues.    Develop and maintain well documented data architecture, enforcing standards across all systems for efficient processes and clean reliable data    Lead HRIS change management process based on feedback/requests and facilitate HRIS change management review board in a cross-functional, matrixed environment.    Run Workday weekly and semi-annual release updates to ensure proper configuration and testing of new functionality.    Provide direction, training, establish objectives and performance feedback to HRIS team members. Prioritize work across teams to ensure maximum productivity in meeting both project-related work and production support work. Ensure processes are documented and controls for system changes are in place and adhered to.    Participate in lessons-learned sessions and documentation for future projects.    Identifies training needs of end-users and develops and provides the necessary training to meet those needs    Relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals     Minimum Requirements:      Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent related experience    Demonstrated background in setting up Workday HRIS and managing it in a full life-cycle capacity (design, implementation, day-to-day operations, releases and upgrades).    Experience with or ability to learn other HRIS systems (as stated previously).     Experience Required:      10 – 15 years    BS/BA degree in Human Resources, Information Technology, or equivalent experience.    10+ years knowledge of HR programs and processes and delivering HR technology solutions.    5+ years functional and systems administration experience in Workday with multiple modules, security and integration systems.    Strong partner with demonstrated capacity for strategic and critical thinking and tactical execution.    Team player with excellent organization, prioritization, project and time management skills to meet deadlines in a dynamic organization with multiple challenging projects.    A multi-dimensional professional who is technologically savvy and skilled in strategy, delivery and operational efficiencies. Location:  Arlington, VA  Security Clearance:  SECRET  We are seeking a Formal Methods Engineer/Scientist/ Mathematician to support DARPA to work with an exceptionally talented and high performing team on challenging and cutting-edge projects. The project involves working with high assurance, high confidence, or zero-defect software and systems research & development for true mission critical solutions. Specifically, we’re seeking someone with the connection of Formal Methods, with an understanding of DevSecOps, applied to applications such as cloud and cyber physical systems.  This position will focus on a range of research programs related to Formal Methods in software development, vulnerability research, and software engineering. Hands-on experience working with military and related intelligence community stakeholders and end users in the use and application of related technologies is desired.  Duties include but not limited to the following:  • Support management of cutting-edge research efforts related to Formal Methods approaches;  • Perform technology and research management of programs related to software engineering, embedded systems, complex high assurance systems, and cybersecurity;  • Provide significant contributions across a range of technical areas by identifying, analyzing, and developing novel technologies and methodologies for current and new program development;  • Provide in-depth expertise in the assessments of proposals to determine the technical merit of proposal objectives and methodologies;  • Develop test plans for assessment of program research performers’ systems;  • Coordinate with program performers throughout the testing of programs to ensure that systems meet test plan requirements;  • Contribute significantly across a range of technical areas by identifying and monitoring ongoing cyber threats through open source and internal data analysis;  • Use information analysis expertise to identify, develop, and support methodologies for current and new program development;  • Work will be performed onsite at DARPA in Arlington, VA;  • Travel may be required up to 10% of the time.  REQUIREMENTS: • Experience with formal methods in software engineering;  • Experience in development of high confidence software, complex high assurance systems, and/or high assurance software;  • 4-year bachelor degree (or higher) in Computer Science, Engineering, Information or Mathematics.  Prefer a TS/SCI or a Secret clearance. For an exceptionally qualified candidate we will take a clearable US Citizen.

Overview:           ERPi is proud to support the Joint Artificial Intelligence Center (JAIC) Joint Logistics (JL) team – sharing knowledge on Artificial Intelligence (AI) benefits, support data consolidation and cleansing for AI use, and provide expertise on AI model development. ERPi is seeking a Joint Logistics Solutions Engineer to provide programs with the tools, data, and architecture to develop, train, integrate, and adopt AI models that reduce Not Mission Capable (NMC) rates.              The Joint Logistics Solutions Engineer will:            Leverage their understanding of logistics domain expertise: This includes in-depth understanding of logistics data, how it is used, DoD data standards and policy, and database management      Lead business analysis and stakeholder engagement: This includes completing surveys of the Services and logistics Agencies to discern their data strategy and data architecture; schedule and lead interviews with identified Joint Logistics stakeholders, capture information gleaned, and organize into a database; engage stakeholders spanning government agencies (Logistic Enterprise Support Agency (LESA), Logistics Data Analytics Center (LDAC), Air Force Life Cycle Management Center (AFLCMC), Program Management Air (PMA) 299, Engineer Research and Development Center (ERDC), Army Research Lab (ARL), Air Force Research Lab (AFRL), etc.)      Lead data architecture and mapping: Build a comprehensive data map based on stakeholder interview findings (e.g., diagram of data required for AI modeling and the authoritative sources); review the database and data map to provide recommendations to Joint Logistics; document defining data ownership issues, security concerns, missing MOUs for access, processes, policies (or policy barriers), access points, APIs, etc.      Support data evaluation and integration: Review the current state of logistics data, comparing the current state, and future data plan, to the state of data needed by AI, we can determine data gaps and issues            Qualifications: Required & Desired Skills and Clearance. (Please list in bullet format):      Required Skills and Experience:              DoD Secret Clearance Required (Interim ok)       Level 1 Solutions Engineer requires at least an Associates Degree in computer engineering or related field and at least 4 years of relevant work experience       Data architecture experience to include expertise with SQL, database structure, data mapping, cloud infrastructure       Logistics experience spanning Army, Navy, Air Force, Marine Corps, and/or other logistics Agencies (e.g. Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) and Transportation Command (TRANSCOM))       Ability to be an innovative, resourceful, and collaborative problem solver       Strong organization, prioritization, team-work and communication skills       Ability to communicate thoughts, ideas, and solutions logically in written and oral situations                  About ERPi:        Enterprise Resource Performance Inc. operates as a business unit of ECS Federal and is a professional services management ﬁrm that delivers strategic, advisory, technological, and implementation support services to Federal Agencies. ERPi offers talented candidates the opportunity to perform project management, strategic planning, process improvement, quality management, data analysis, and human capital planning on some of the Federal government’s largest and most complex business challenges. Our work environment is highly entrepreneurial and is staffed with some of the brightest and most capable, technical people in the industry. In addition to a comprehensive and flexible benefits program, our offerings include tuition reimbursement, 401(k) profit sharing, industry-leading health plans, generous paid parental leave and matched charitable donations. ERPi is committed to people development and providing opportunities to grow professionally. As an employee, you will work with highly motivated colleagues and have the advantage of a culture that is focused on bringing out the best in you.              Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled               EEO Statement:      It has been and will continue to be a fundamental policy of ERPi not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, parental status, marital status, citizenship, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, military status, veteran status, or any other protected category with respect to recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, and other terms and conditions of employment.

Description: The Lockheed Martin Mission System Capabilities (MSC) Machine Learning Team is seeking a high energy research scientist/developer to support several MSC programs. In this role, you will be embedded in the AI team working alongside data engineers, Machine Learning / AI engineers, software architects, and data scientists. This person should be focused on innovative approaches to enhance the efficiency of getting products to the war fighter using machine learning. The candidate should also have a passion for imaging science, math and physics.  This Candidate would be responsible for design/implement/test new algorithm capabilities in support signal/image processing, and would be able to develop scripts/code in matlab and/or python to prototype and evaluate capabilities.  The selected candidate will:   Work closely with other AI/ML Engineers, Data Scientists and Data Engineering Subject Matter Experts on a variety of machine learning applications. These will be research and analysis as well as operations ready algorithms. Create, update, and evaluate new algorithms and performance. Work in a variety of environments, cloud, edge and on board deployments Applicants selected will be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. Additionally, they will contribute to a broad range of projects across Missions Solutions to increase value to the customer.  Basic Qualifications:  Experience in designing and evaluating algorithms in Matlab/Python Strong in mathematics and physics Modeling and performance assessment of remote sensing systems Solid understanding of remote sensing phenomenology Experience in research, and development Experience in machine learning, deep learning, and computer vision (e.g. CNNs, Detection Networks, Segmentation Networks, etc.) Knowledge of data science workflows Desired Skills:  MS in EE or Imaging Science Experience in evaluating Remote Sensing Systems Ability to follow disciplined coding standards and practices Experience in multiple remote sensing phenomenologies (for example EO/IR/SAR) Experience in enhanced image processing techniques (for example artifact detection and mitigation) Radiometric calibration of remote sensing systems Experience with 2D and 3D registration algorithms for image products Proficient in programming languages (Python, Java, MatLab, JavaScript, C++) Knowledge of cloud-based technologies Knowledge of data science technologies (AWS/C2S – specifically Sagemaker, Docker, Kubernetes, Keras, Tensorflow, etc.) Knowledge of DevSecOps software development practices Knowledge of IT distributed system architectures Experience in enterprise software applications (JIRA, Slack, etc.) BASIC QUALIFICATIONS: job.Qualifications   Lockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. As a leading technology innovation company, Lockheed Martin’s vast team works with partners around the world to bring proven performance to our customers’ toughest challenges. job_title: Senior Research Scientist – Machine Learning: Signals and Language
job_Description: Overview  The  Data Science Team  applies expertise in machine learning, data visualization, statistics, and computational architectures to solve hard research challenges in AI security & privacy, synthetic biology, cyber security, computational social science, code analysis, biometrics, and other areas. We have built systems that summarize source code, predict protein stability, visualize complex networks with millions of nodes, and detect stealthy denial-of-service attacks. Our team values creativity, initiative, collaboration, and diversity. We strive for a fun and collegial atmosphere that encourages intellectual cross-pollination and professional growth. We are passionate about empowering our customers' missions and enjoy working together at the leading edge of technology!  Responsibilities Include:  As a  Senior Research Scientist , you will research and implement novel machine learning methods, apply them to challenging problem domains, and present empirical research results with the potential for real-world operational impact. You will develop, apply, and evaluate state-of-the-art acoustic, signal processing, and natural language processing techniques to solve complex cyber problems. You will work collaboratively on a multidisciplinary team alongside experts in cybersecurity, machine learning, and software development with clients that include DARPA and other government agencies. You may also contribute to technical proposals in new research areas.  Minimum Qualifications:   3+ years of experience developing, implementing, and applying deep learning models to challenging research problems in automatic speech recognition (ASR), speaker identification, acoustic event detection, language modeling, or related tasks  2+ years of software development with Python and Python machine learning frameworks (e.g., PyTorch, TensorFlow, Espresso, Kaldi)  Bachelor's degree in machine learning, CS, EE, Applied Math, Stats, or a related field, or 2+ years additional professional experience  Active DoD Top Secret security clearance and willingness to work on site in Arlington, VA   Nice If You Have:   Experience with signal processing techniques such as source localization, noise removal, channel estimation and modeling, or beamforming  Experience building working software prototypes or strong knowledge of CS fundamentals (programming languages, operating systems, computer architecture, etc.)  Experience generating training data for acoustic, biometric, or language-related tasks  Graduate degree or publication record in a relevant field  Experience communicating empirical research results in written, visual, and spoken forms to technical and non-technical audiences   Security Clearance   Active TS security clearance required   Two Six Technologies is an Equal Opportunity Employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic corrected by the law.   #LI-JS1 #LI-Onsite   Two Six Technologies is an  Equal Opportunity Employer . All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at Two Six Technologies without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, physical and mental disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, veteran, marital, pregnancy or citizenship status; or any other status prohibited by applicable national, federal, state or local law. job_title: Associate/Senior Associate, Modeling & Valuation- Climate Risk
job_Description: The KPMG Advisory practice is currently our fastest growing practice. We are seeing tremendous client demand, and looking forward we don't anticipate that slowing down. In this ever-changing market environment, our professionals must be adaptable and thrive in a collaborative, team-driven culture. At KPMG, our people are our number one priority. With a wealth of learning and career development opportunities, a world-class training facility and leading market tools, we make sure our people continue to grow both professionally and personally. If you're looking for a firm with a strong team connection where you can be your whole self, have an impact, advance your skills, deepen your experiences, and have the flexibility and access to constantly find new areas of inspiration and expand your capabilities, then consider a career in Advisory. KPMG is currently seeking an Associate/Senior Associate in Risk & Compliance - Modeling & Valuations for our Consulting practice. Responsibilities: Provide technical knowledge with respect to the application of complex regulatory requirements involving climate risk management, climate scenario analysis, climate data processing, storage, and visualization Architect and analyze predictive modeling involving the use of climate, economic, and financial data, statistical algorithms, simulation methods, time-series analysis, regression, statistical inference validation tools, Monte-Carlo and Variance simulations and/or machine learning techniques to identify the likelihood of future outcomes Enhance existing financial and risk models with climate (Transition and Physical) risk drivers, where applicable; lead and support our clients in transitioning to integrate climate risk and opportunities within their business to better position and achieve their future climate targets Perform analysis around the integration of climate science and government policies into economic and financial modeling; carry out climate risk assessments and extreme events analysis Contribute to the development and maintenance of KPMGs suite of market-leading climate risk transition and physical risk models and analytics Develop and analyze large datasets using mathematical and statistical modeling and other business analysis tools such as Python, R, and SAS Qualifications: Minimum one year of work experience in a field related to Applied Mathematics, Optimization Mathematical programming, Climate/Earth Systems, Atmospheric sciences or Statistics Master’s degree or Ph.D. from an accredited college/university in a related field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Climate/Earth System Science, Atmospheric Science, Meteorology, Hydrology, or Environmental Engineering from an accredited college/university Experience with multivariate modeling techniques, uncertainty quantification, or ensemble analysis; exposure to climate models (i.e., CMIP5, GCMs, RCMs) and physical risk data providers is a plus Familiarity and understanding of the Network for Greening the Financial System (“NGFS”), Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (“IPCC”), and International Energy Association (“IEA”) scenarios, their use, and the translation required of its underlying climate risks drivers into financial and economic system impacts Ability to travel as needed Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the United States without the need for visa sponsorship now or in the future  Additional Qualifications for Senior Associate: Minimum three years of work experience in a field related to Applied Mathematics, Optimization/ Mathematical programming, Climate/Earth Systems, Atmospheric sciences or Statistics High competency level with programming software such as Python (preferred), R, SAS, VBA; familiarity with data visualization tools such as Qlikview, Tableau as well as web application front end (HTML, CSS, JavaScript) and back end (Ruby on Rails, Django, PHP, Flask) is preferred Strong experience with climate/economic scenario expansion and/or econometric modeling for scenario analysis and stress testing purposes KPMG LLP (the U.S. member firm of KPMG International) offers a comprehensive compensation and benefits package. KPMG is an affirmative action-equal opportunity employer. KPMG complies with all applicable federal, state and local laws regarding recruitment and hiring. All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other category protected by applicable federal, state or local laws. The attached link contains further information regarding the firm's compliance with federal, state and local recruitment and hiring laws. No phone calls or agencies please. In some circumstances, individuals who are not fully vaccinated may also be required to have a reasonable accommodation to not be fully vaccinated for COVID-19.

Statistician [Sr. Manager] (Remote Working & located in Maryland or Massachusetts)                  This position is contingent upon contract award.               The Statistician is a PhD graduate who, is part of a multidisciplinary team, that would support the scope of work that a Quality Improvement Organization completes. External Quality Review Activities and related activities performed for this role would be executed for MassHealth Healthcare organizations such as Managed Care Organizations, Accountable Care Organizations etc. Activities for this role would include: Performance Measure Validation, Performance Improvement Validation, Compliance Reviews, and Network Adequacy Validation. The Statistician would work closely with the Project Director, and Clinical Director. This position is contingent upon contract award status.        RESPONSIBILITIES & COMPETENCIES        Demonstrated experience and knowledge of:      1. Medicaid population, policies, data systems and processes;      2. Quality management and improvement methods;      3. Managed care delivery systems, organizations, and financing;      4. Measurement design methodology, including statistical analysis; and      5. Other areas as required to perform specific External Quality Review (EQR) Activities.        In addition to the above, the successful incumbent is expected to consistently demonstrate:          A positive working attitude that supports the needs of the care management team      Support of the mission and values of Medicalincs and a commitment to a person-centered, family-centered, culturally competent philosophical base.      Commitment to continuous quality improvement working with co-workers in a team-oriented collaborative governance model.      Flexibility and the ability to adapt to the changing healthcare environment and legislation.                QUALIFICATIONS          PhD degree required      5 years experience in managed care and quality improvement preferred           REQUIREMENTS        The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job.        While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is regularly required to stand, walk, sit; use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls; and reach with hands and arms. The employee frequently lifts and moves up to 10 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus. The employee is required to complete onsite visits with clients by driving to their homes, schools, physician offices, and other healthcare facilities. The employee is required to document client-related activities and conversations on their laptop in our client database within 48 hours of the client interaction.        OTHER DUTIES        Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activates, duties, or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job.        ABOUT MEDICALINCS        Medicalincs (Medicalincs) is a renowned healthcare business & clinical management services firm that supports health organizations to improve organizational performance by providing less expensive, human-centered, integrated, managed care solutions. We have significantly improved health outcomes, cost savings, and return on investment for our clients.        Founded in 2013 and launched in 2017, we are located at Silver Spring, Maryland, and serve the Maryland, District of Columbia, and Virginia regions.        OUR MISSION: At Medicalincs, our mission is to link silos in the healthcare system - to achieve the most cost-effective, high quality, and continually-improved care delivery that preserves & saves lives!        OUR PHILOSOPHY: To make a difference, you need to be THICK - Trusted, Hearty, Innovative, Committed, & Kaizen!        Medicalincs brings a unique understanding of healthcare delivery systems across healthcare settings & payer groups; and in-depth experience applying strategic fusion of clinical, business, and technical expertise - to drive comprehensive and tried-and-true lasting solutions to advance networks and population health management. Our areas of expertise include: Managed Care & Care Value | Care Delivery Model Transformation Implementation | Quality Improvement & Patient Safety | Program Management & Change Management | Program Evaluation & Data Analytics |Organizational Development & Strategic Planning.        Medicalincs takes a rigorous approach to recruiting talent to our company that balances equal parts role-specific competencies and cultural fit. Our process ensures that we can provide the right professional, with the proper expertise, to each and every one of our clients. As experts in the management space, we believe effective service delivery should be the rule, not the exception. Far from being a one-size-fits-all solutions provider, we provide right-sized management support, tailored to best fit the needs of our clients. With a results-driven focus, we listen to our clients and work to help them meet their specific program and organizational goals.

Solutions Through Innovative Technologies, Inc. (STI-TEC) specializes in the delivery of professional business and information management services. STI-TEC offers government and commercial clients a comprehensive portfolio of services that identify, manage, distribute and improve business processes related to entities’ most valued resource, information. As a fast-growing solutions provider, established in 2000, total customer satisfaction has remained the cornerstone of our business. Our business model focuses on integrity, loyalty, and trust.        Position Overview     Provide Advisory and Assistance Services (A&AS) services to accomplish Engineering and Analytical support tasks including assessments through ISR analysis, modeling, simulation, and visualization, to include the following: Execution and integration support of modeling and simulation tools; Design, development, and testing of assessments methodologies, techniques, and databases; Perform operations analysis and data evaluation to identify trends and patterns; Generate briefs, data visualizations and technical reports; and Perform operation and maintenance of associated systems and data, as specified.        Essential Job Function        ISR Data Acquisition, Management, and Analysis Support. Provide the following A&AS support for the J-32 Assessments Data Initiative:     Identify relevant ISR data sources for ISR data acquisition, develop repeatable methods to access said data, condition the data for analysis, and identify the relationships between the various data sources.     Assist with the management of collected ISR data sources to include regularly updating data sources at relevant intervals, backing up data, and performing regular database maintenance.     Conduct analysis utilizing the J-32 Assessments analytic software.     ISR Data Management Support: Contractor personnel shall provide the following A&AS support:     Support the exploration, identification, extraction, transformation, loading, and visualization of ISR-related data sources.     Provide management assistance for maintaining a warehouse of ISR-related data. Support automation of data gathering, as well as, data cleaning for customer use.     Assist with analysis of collected data using specified Commercial off the Shelf (COTS) Computer Software (CS), Government off the Shelf (GOTS) CS, or other data analytics CS.     Provide digital content and knowledge management assistance services for essential J-32 ISR mission data using specified COTS, GOTS, or other content management CS and computer software services including the following:         Microsoft SharePoint front-end development and design;      Data Analytics Software such as Tableau for data visualizations;      ArcGIS for map creation and analysis;      Microsoft Excel VBA (Visual Basic for Applications) for data normalization;      Data statistical analysis software such as R; and 1      Data transformation and manipulation tools such as Python.        Joint ISR Capability Development: Develop, maintain, update, generate, operate, and document computer software, databases, and methodologies, and maintain and operate computer hardware as specified by the Government to support ISR decisions.     Solicit, gather, document, organize, and validate functional requirements for existing and new IT systems that support Joint ISR enterprise mission management functions.     Prepare validated requirements for review, prioritization, coordination, approval and submission to approved IT systems developers for execution and implementation.     Advise and assist government representatives in the development of functional IT integration concepts and operational architectures supporting Joint ISR enterprise mission management functions.     Provide tools development and project management support as specified by the Government including IT resource management and prioritization, acceptance testing, feedback, and socialization of new capabilities.     ISR Collections and Operations Analysis Support: Sshall provide A&AS support for analysis of global ISR collection operations to establish and document the performance and effectiveness of platforms, sensors, and associated TCPED architecture including the following:     ISR Collection Analysis Support. Conduct analyses and assessments for improving operational planning, integration, and synchronization of systems including manned and unmanned airborne, space-based, maritime surface and subsurface and terrestrial sensors and systems coupled with associated TCPED in collaboration with CCMD, Combat Support Agency, and IC analysts.     Develop and maintain methodologies, metrics, processes, and databases to assess ISR capabilities, utilization, and employment plans.     Collect, collate, standardize, update, and validate information needed to support analysis and assessment.     Conduct comprehensive ISR assessments across the full spectrum of platforms and sensors and the TCPED cycle including requirements, allocation of ISR resources, and the intelligence value of resulting products.     Perform visualization and data management services for assessment tasks, providing data in required formats and using repeatable solutions to solve data integration problems including developing or utilizing software program patch configurations, bridge concepts, or data manipulation of COTS and GOTS computer software programs. (     Provide technical review of ISR Collection Analysis output products.     Provide ISR Gaps and Shortfall Analysis Support: Assess adequacy and effectiveness of the ISR support to CCMD and Joint Staff and DOD information needs, requirements, and priorities.     Assess the ability of Global Force Management allocated ISR assets to accomplish assigned collection in global and theater plans and operations.     Conduct assessments and evaluate current ISR capabilities across the enterprise to identify gaps, shortfalls, and future risk in collaboration with IC and designated mission partners.        - Provide response support and capability to requests for hypothetical-based, issue- based, or ad-hoc ISR assessments as follows: Facilitate the entire assessment planning and execution processes including establishing team members, defining scope, developing data collection plans, executing plans, and processing data generated to support assessments.        Crisis, Contingency, and Exercises Support:     Shall support crisis/contingency/exercise manning, planning/conferences, and execution.     Use modeling and simulation tools to validate processes and products as required.     Support the development of ISR TTPs, best practices and lessons learned.     Use alternative work schedules to support contingencies within funded labor hours, unless additional hours and funds are added to task order in subsequent modifications.        Minimum Qualifications        Shall possess ten (10) years demonstrated relevant current experience with the following qualifications:     Performing data extractions, transformation, and loading     Data warehouse management     Using COTS or GOTS data analytic software     Content management using COTS, GOTS, or other content management programs and services including the following experience in utilizing:         Data Analytics Software such as Tableau for data visualizations      ArcGIS Portal & Insights for map creation and analysis      MS Excel VBA (Visual Basic for Applications) for data normalization      Data statistical analysis software      Python        Performing data cleansing and normalization     Building of data dashboards with access by customers     Understanding of the military operational environment     Understanding of defense collection management processes and supporting databases     Shall possess ten (10) years demonstrated relevant current experience with the following qualifications:     ISR and collection management experience     Ability to identify and discern gaps in ISR data required to establish a creditable ISR database     Experience in evaluating and prioritizing ISR data sources     Capable of establishing and improving customer access to ISR data     Proficiency with Microsoft Suite software including Outlook, Word, PowerPoint, Excel, and Access.     Demonstrated knowledge of Arc Geographic Information System (ARcGiS) and Google Earth or other similar visualization tools.     Knowledge of the intelligence cycle and how the same relates to DoD collection operations, platforms, and sensors.     Demonstrate experience with the following: IC, DoD, and global ISR intelligence disciplines such as GEOINT and SIGINT; Collection Requirements Management and associated software tools such as GIMS, PRISM, NSRP, and SAVANT; and Collection Operations Management and associated software tools such as ROME and BVI.     Demonstrate experience with COTS data analytic applications such as SAS Federal, Tableau, and Spotfire.     Shall be a United States citizen and comply with applicable program security requirements.     A final Top Secret (TS) security clearance with eligibility for Sensitive Compartmented Information (SCI), Nuclear Command and Control (NC2), and Special Access Program (SAP) security access with the ability to pass a Counter Intelligence (CI) polygraph interview.           Applicants selected may be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.
